    Monitor cloud resources - Remediation planning

    »

    1. The primary objective of a key performance indicator (KPI) is to:

      Trigger an action such as a warning or alert when something is wrong or is about to go wrong

      Log problems and the actions taken to correct them in a persistent data store for later analysis

      Quantify the performance of a system as it relates to one of the following: health, success in meeting business objectives, user satisfaction, or speed in mitigating problems

      Determine who to blame when a system goes down


    2. The basic principle of everyday remediation is to:

      Ensure that system administrators are aware when problems occur that affect the responsiveness of a system or its ability to serve business objectives.

      Ensure that system administrators are aware when the ratio of requests processed to requests received falls below a specified threshold, usually 50\%.

      Use performance metrics of various types to promptly mitigate breakages when they occur, and to identify trends in the IT department’s response time.

      Use performance metrics of various types to continually improve a system, even when it hasn’t reached a breaking point.
